title: Socket.IO Client Setup
description:
Configure Socket.IO Client Integration in Next.js Frontend

Set up Socket.IO client connection in the Next.js application to enable real-time bidirectional communication with the backend server.

Requirements:
- Install and configure Socket.IO client library compatible with Next.js
- Create a Socket.IO client instance with proper connection configuration (URL, auth, reconnection settings)
- Implement connection lifecycle management (connect, disconnect, reconnect handling)
- Set up event listeners for incoming server events
- Create utility functions or hooks for emitting events to the server
- Handle connection errors and display appropriate user feedback
- Ensure compatibility with Next.js rendering patterns (CSR/SSR considerations)
- Implement cleanup on component unmount to prevent memory leaks
- Add connection state management (connected, disconnected, reconnecting)
- Consider implementing a context provider or custom hook for reusable socket access across components

Edge Cases to Consider:
- Handle socket initialization in server-side rendered components
- Manage reconnection attempts when server is unavailable
- Handle authentication token refresh if socket connection requires auth
- Prevent multiple socket instances from being created
- Handle page navigation without breaking active connections
